title._content: ["Welwyn," Harold Irving Pratt house, 100 Crescent Beach Road, Glen Cove, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Welwyn," Harold Irving Pratt house, 100 Crescent Beach Road, Glen Cove, New York. Pathway] [ca. 1914] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Georgian revival house by Babb, Cook & Welsh, 1904-1906, with alterations by Delano & Aldrich, mid-1910s. Landscape: Martha Brookes Brown Hutcheson and James Leal Greenleaf, 1911-1913. Associated Name: Harriet Barnes (Mrs. Harold I.) Pratt. Other: Site and drive planning in "Dosoris," the Pratt family compound of houses belonging to the children of Charles Pratt, Frederick Law Olmsted, Jr., E.C. Whiting, Olmsted Brothers, 1906. Today: Gardens in part preserved as Welwyn Preserve, Glen Cove. The house is the Holocaust Memorial & Tolerance Center of Nassau County. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16864 Call Number: LC-J717-X109- 59
